Key Match Events: Christian Bethancourt drove in seven runs, including a go-ahead two-run single in the ninth, as the Chicago Cubs rallied past the Pittsburgh Pirates 14-10.
Bethancourt hit a two-run homer in the seventh to start Chicago's surge.
Bethancourt added a two-run double in the eighth and laced a sharp bases-loaded single to left against Pirates closer David Bednar to complete the comeback.
Pete Crow-Armstrong had a career-high four hits.
Bryan Reynolds and Connor Joe both homered and finished with three hits for Pittsburgh.
Oneil Cruz singled and doubled while making his first career start in center field.
Post-Match Reflections: Christian Bethancourt expressed his amazement at his performance, saying, "(RBI are) a big part of the game. And you get as many as I did today, that’s an unbelievable day. That’s probably a day I will not forget."
Pirates manager Derek Shelton admitted his frustration after the collapse, saying, "I don’t know if I’ve been as (angry) as I am right now."
Miscellaneous Highlights: Chicago Cubs scored 41 runs across three games at PNC Park.
Others: Cubs: RHP Ben Brown (neck strain) is unlikely to return this season.
Cubs: RHP Ethan Roberts exited with ankle soreness after pitching 1 1/3 innings of relief.
Pirates: DH Andrew McCutchen (knee) has resumed all baseball activities and could return this weekend.
Pirates: 3B Ke'Bryan Hayes has had multiple doctors look at his lower back, with no definitive diagnosis.
Pirates: Yasmani Grandal and Rowdy Tellez were both removed late because of the heat.
